1.question: What is the purpose of administrative domains (ADOMs) on FortiManager?
options: A. To enable FortiManager as a local FortiGuard distribution server
B. To divide administrator of devices and restrict administrator access
C. To enable logging
D. To allow global access for administrators

2.question: What Does the Fabric View pane allow you to do?
options: A. View security fabric ratings of configurations for FortiGate security fabric groups
B. Generate security fabric ratings for FortiGate devices
C. Enable per device logging
D. Rate each FortiGate

3.question: Which statement about the global ADOM layer is true?
options: A. The same policy can be assigned to multiple ADOMs
B. Global ADOM rules automatically installed on managed ForitGate Devices
C. Allows per device configuration
D. Does not effect header and footer policies

4.question: What information is recorded in the device manager layer for managed devices on FortiManager?
options: A. Common ADOM object database
B. Real-time status of managed devices
C. Global device configurations
D. Real-time logs

5.question: Which statement about FortiAnalyzer features on FortiManager is true?
options: A. FortiManager does not support the reports
B. FortiManager has logging rate restrictions as compared to FortiAnalyzer
C. FortiManager does not allow any logging
D. FortiManager has more log capability than FortiAnalyzer

6.question: Which port is used between FortiManager and FortiGate for IPv4 remote configuration management of FortiGate devices?
options: A. TCP 145
B. TCP 514
C. TCP 5114
D. TCP 541

7.question: Which statement about a large MSSP using FortiManager is true?
options: A. Each customer must have a dedicated FortiManager device
B. FortiManager is not recommended in an MSSP scenario
C. ADOMs can be used to separate customers
D. VDOMs can be used to seperate customers

8.question: Which of the following APIs are available on FortiManager?
options: A. REST API
B. UML API
C. JSON API
D. XML API

9.question: What is the main purpose of Backup ADOM mode?
options: A. To allow ADOM locking
B. To install policy package changes offline
C. To filter ADOMs
D. To maintain the backup configuration of managed devices

10.question: How can you restrict an administrator’s access to only a few ADOMs on FortiManager?
options: A. By disabling concurrent access to ADOMs
B. By assigning ADOMs to the administrator account
C. Utilizing trusted hosts
D. Protocol restricton

11.question: Which of the following feature is available on the Restricted Admin profile?
options: A. Device registration
B. IPS Sensor
C. Security Fabric
D. Log View

12.question: When should an administrator consider using workspace mode?
options: A. When an administrator only uses one specific ADOM
B. When multiple managed FortiGate devices have a single administrator
C. Always
D. When multiple administrators require concurrent access

13.question: Which statement is true regarding locking an ADOM?
options: A. It automatically removes locks on devices and policy packages
B. Other administrators have read/write access
C. It requires admin approval to unlock a device
D. There is no locking on an ADOM level

14.question: How can you restrict an administrator’s access to only a few ADOMs on FortiManager?
options: A. By disabling concurrent access to ADOMs
B. By setting up restricted hosts
C. By assigning ADOMs to the administrator account
D. By restricting protocols

15.question: Which of the following steps are the best practices after FortiGate firmware upgrade?
options: A. Push policy package and run script to update objects
B. Upgrade the ADOM and retrieve configuration
C. Restore from backup
D. Configure new backup

16.question: Which of the following steps are included in the FortiManager backup?
options: A. Logs and firmware images
B. Global database and all devices
C. ADOM only database
D. Configuration only

17.question: Which of the following statements are true regarding scheduled backups of FortiManager?
options: A. Supports FTP, SCP and SFTP
B. Can be configured using the CLI and GUI
C. Can only be done through scripts
D. Can be scheduled for off-hours only

18.question: When should an administrator use event logs at debug level?
options: A. Fortinet never recommends debug levels
B. When searching for an admin event log
C. When investigating a FortiManager issue with technical support
D. Always

19.question: What is the main purpose of using APIs on FortiManager?
options: A. Can manage FortiManager device using third-party software and hardware
B. Can manage many devices without a FortiManager license
C. Gathering informaton
D. Reporting

20.question: Which of the following statements are true regarding system templates?
options: A. Facilitate identical device-level settings across many devices
B. You can use them to install a common policy package across multiple devices
C. System templates are an older feature of FortiManager and no longer used
D. Can be used to restore from backup

21.question: What is the main benefit of exporting a template from one ADOM to another?
options: A. All policy packages also get exported along with the template
B. Can also be used as a backup template
C. You can use the same template across devices in multiple ADOMs without much effort
D. You retain header and footer policies

22.question: When you link the model device to the real device, what are the two methods you could use?
options: A. IP Address and serial number
B. IP Address and Hostname
C. Hostname and serial number
D. Serial number and preshared key

23.question: What is the # diagnose dvm device list command use for?
options: A. To view individual cluster members of the FortiGate HA Cluster
B. To install all the pending device configuration changes using the CLI
C. To diagnose errors
D. To show configuration of each device

24.question: How do you enable FGFM access on FortiGate?
options: A. Through the FortiGate interfaces
B. Through FortiGate admin settings
C. Through the FortiManager CLI
D. Through the FortiGate CLI

25.question: Which FGFM process runs on FortiGate?
options: A. FGFMSD
B. FGFMD
C. SFGFMD
D. FGFM does not run on the FortiGate

26.question: How does FortiManager determine if sync status of a managed device is Out-Of-Sync
options: A. It compares current revision history with FortiGate configuration
B. It compares device level database with FortiGate configuration
C. It compares the ADOM level database with the device level database
D. FortiManager is unable to determine when a managed device is out-of-sync

27.question: What does device settings status modified indiciate?
options: A. Configuration changes made directly on FortiGate are automatically updated on FortiManager and tagged as Modified
B. Device-level configuration changes are made on FortiManager for the managed devices

28.question: Which option should you select when installing policy package changes?
options: A. Install Device Settings only
B. Install Policy Package only
C. Install Policy Package and Device Settings

29.question: What is the key difference between the install wizard and install config option?
options: A. The install wizard goes through many steps
B. The install config goes through many steps

30.question: What is the one of the main ways that you can take advantage of the revision history?
options: A. To modify FortiManager system settings
B. To view and download a FortiGate configuration revision
C. To change the revision history
D. To accept risk

31.question: What is the main benefit of FortiManager’s revert feature?
options: A. Admin can make global ADOM changes
B. Admin can factory-reset FortiManager
C. Admin can revert the device database to a previous revision
D. Admin can enable logging

32.question: What type of scripts are supported on FortiManager?
options: A. Bash and Linux shell scripts
B. Python scripts
C. Perl Scripts
D. CLI and TCL Scripts

33.question: What happens to the Device Settings status if you execute a script using the Remote FortiGate?
options: A. It will be tagged as Auto-Updated
B. It will be tagged as Modified
C. Nothing
D. You cannot execute scripts using a remote FortiGate

34.question: What is the purpose of the dynamic objects?
options: A. To merge duplicate objects automatically
B. To map a single logical object to a unique definition per device

35.question: Which one of the following statements is correct regarding a policy package?
options: A. A policy package can have multiple installation targets in an ADOM
B. There can be only one policy package per ADOM

36.question: What does a policy package status of Unknown indicate?
options: A. FortiManager is unable to determine the policy package status
B. The policy package was never installed from FortiManager
C. FortiManager is able to see the package but unable to parse the package
